title: Damage has increased... and keeps increasing.
body:
The damage dealt by champions in general is just too high imo... I'm not saying "oh buff tanks". I'm saying if I build {{item:3742}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3075}}  as a shyvana, I shouldnt, under any situation really, die in less than 1 or 2 seconds...

I think just, lowing damage across the board would be a good idea. Just like, 20% or so. The reason I say this is that it offers more counterplay in almost any situation. The longer a fight lasts, the more likely the better player will be to win the fight. I don't care how good you are, getting 100 to 0ed by an assassin as an adc is kind of unfun. Or as a tank, building 5 or 6 straight up tank items and getting melted in seconds. IDK if im the only one who has noticed the damage creep as of late.

Edit: Just to clarify, I mean I shouldn't die to a team composed of AD champs that quickly with the build. And thank you to all the people completely ignoring the post and choosing to inspect and criticize my build against a fictional team. It's JUST an example. People who get too caught up analyzing an example instead of the point made just take away from the conversation, not add to it.

Hey riot stop with champion releases and fix the balance in the game and update old champions
"Shhh boi we need more skins"
There ARE totally different departments that change different parts of the games. The skin team has nothing to do with balance.

i agree, though there would be need for adjustments.
Most burst centered champions would need changes, as they rely on beeing able to 100-0 opponents. If they can't do that, they do no much at all.
But on the long run, overall reduced damage and kits beeing balanced around **NOT** haveing 100-0 patterns would certainly be better for the game.
That's where I think Riot made a mistake. NO champion should be able to 100-0 another champion. Assassins should be striking at wounded targets: 50-0 them. IMO.
The problem is that late every champ is either too tanky to assasinate or has lifesteal so is never 50% health.

They removed spellvamp because for some reason a mage shouldn't be able to blow all his cooldowns and half his mana to recover maybe 200hp once every ten seconds...

But they left in all overpowered AD lifesteal items so that hypercarries and assassins can recover 500hp **twice per second** with no resource expenditure or cooldown limitations ... just by auto-attacking.

All this even in the context of a contemporary and infamous environment wherein mages are notoriously underperforming and literally worse than free kills for enemy AD assassins (like Zed, Yi and Yasuo). Let's just sit back and think about what that means for a moment.
I agree with lifestyle, I feel that it's retarded that an assassin can't kill a  new adc like vayne or yasuo because of how much they heal from aa's
I wouldn't say that, because that would mean everyone bursty would get their damage decreased. Imagine how crappy it would feel to throw a Veigar ult at a squishy and only have it do 25% of their HP.

Why should someone do over 25% of someone's health with a single ability, especially a targeted one?

IMO, longer fights would benefit Veigar more due to his new passive. More opportunities to Q and W, making him have an advantage over other champions with this change.

I dont think it wrong to be able to 100 - 0 a squishy champ who built NO defensive items. If 100 - 0 is a serious threat, you should seriously have to build a defensive item. If however you can build only defensive items and still get 100-0d in less than 10 seconds (in my opinion, this is what tanks should be capabale of) then there is a serious problem. Champs keep getting buffs to match other champs power levels, but i honestly think it should go the other way for a bit. Adc underperforming compared to other powerful adcs? bring the other adcs back a bit, not the underperformer up (unless its actually a kit related problem). Assassins assassinating everyone, including tanks? Bring their power down a bit. Let them get adcs, and mages with relative ease, but not kill tanks. Bruisers able to 1v3 reliably when not fed? Bring them down. I still dont know the difference between a warrior and a bruiser, because everyone builds warriors like bruisers because they die too easily.

Due to costs of items, Mages can't afford to buy one of the **two** defensive items available to them because even going for pure glass-cannon builds still leaves them useless at end game: AP champions all have truly shitty scaling relative to HP and MR that everyone else is getting just as baseline or part of their default build-paths.

Mages are screwed in absolutely every way right now.

There is no reason to bring a mage when you could bring a Zed, Yi, Khazix, Rengar or Yasuo instead.

They don't rely on 100-0. 

There have been plenty of instances where assassins have been important champions due to the AoE damage they deal with their initiation, or ability to put an opponent out of position. I'm not just talking about LoL. 

IMO, assassins are only healthy when they rely on a little follow up, or are required to follow up, to be successful. 

Near-automatically killing someone because they're in range can't be considered healthy. In any game. People just accept it in League because its been a thing for so long. The truth is that they still shouldn't exist as 100-0 champions because that isn't strategy. Riot has nerfed so many champions because their only 'counterplay' is 'staying out of range'. Yet, assassins continue to exist. 

At least champions like Xin, Irelia, Jax, Fiora, etc aren't instantaneous burst. Fighters are much closer to what assassins should be.

>They ~~don't~~ **shouldn't** rely on 100-0. 

Fixed that for you.


I absulutly agree that 'Near-automatically killing someone because they're in range' is not healthy.
However, right now many assasins(and some burst mages) don't offer enough besides that, if they can't burst a squishy dowsn, there is little reason to pick them over other champions.
This is why many champs would need adjustments to their kits to stay relevant **without** 100-0 pattern.
Look, tanks are very strong right now - it's a TANK meta. So, no, don't lower dmg and, as a side effect, buff tanks even more.

Tank meta?
Where?
When? 
If at all, you have one toplaner who builds tank: yasuo, ekko, fizz this kind of shit.
But those aren't tanks. 
Nauti, Shen, Sion--> tanks.

Yeah, no, tanks are still in a good place. Especially when they don't even need to be fed to turn a game around completely. If you're dying in under 2 seconds against an enemy AD then you've done one of the following.

1. Engaged an enemy without an ally.
Solution: Stay with an ally.

2. Overextended without vision.
Solution: Purchase pinks and place one where needed.

3. Overstayed your welcome after a successful fight.
Solution: Return to base after a successful fight that results in the team securing an objective.

4. You were ganked successfully by multiple enemies.
Solution: None, it happens. No matter how cautious you are.

5. Engaged a fight without your team being ready.
Solution: Ping when you are about to engage and then go in, but make sure your allies have their uits.

6. Died while warding.
Solution: Farsight is a good item for safe warding if you are unable to place regular wards down.

>You were ganked successfully by multiple enemies.
Solution: None, it happens. No matter how cautious you are.

Correction: read the map better next time, if you don't have vision of 3 or more enemies, you are very likely to get ganked by the enemy team.

Prettymuch all of this applies to the earlygame.
The bigger issue are lategame teamfights. I often enough have seen a 6 item fulltank shyvana die within ~2 sec from full health after ulting into the backline.
If you look at winrates, you'll notice that all tanky dps champs have a rather low winrate atm, and those that look stilld decent have a massive earlygame winrate and drop hard as the game progresses, since 'tanking' doesn't work later on.
Either you have nice hard cc on your engage so your team can follow up befor your opponents have the opportunity to focus you down, or you are usless outside of splitpushing, and the main reason for that is the overabundance of damage in the game.

Also, the major issue with the high damage right now is that makeing any mistake ends with an instantanious death, which results in a low-(or even no-) risk meta where playing as save as possible is the key. This makes for rather stale and boring games, as well as the tank meta top that we see in proplay. Tanks mostly get played top because they can funcion on lowish gold and are hard to gank, especially ekko. IF a fulltank 'overextends' he often can buy enough time for the rest of the team to make a cross map play.
As a squishy, your just boned.

A big issue here also is vision. It's so hard to set up proper vision with no stealthwards to buy, nerfed trinkets and nerfed wardstone.
As a result, you nearly always have to expect a gank as you never really have enough vision, which means you either play champs that have rediculous escapes(hello ekko, again) or you sit underneath your tower and bite your time, especially vs junglers like kindret or nida that can easily solo kill you if your dare to get close to the middle of your lane.

Al this contributs alot to the current snowbally feeling of the game.

>If you look at winrates, you'll notice that all tanky dps champs have a rather low winrate atm, and those that look stilld decent have a massive earlygame winrate and drop hard as the game progresses, since 'tanking' doesn't work later on.

That's not because tank champs/gear are underpowered, it's that assassins are too powerful.

AD assassins get all the benefits of their items stacked into their abilities while also stacking it into their auto-attacks which they get no cooldowns or resource gates on. Marksmen also benefit from this specific situation, but they're held back by a general lack of free "escape" and defense abilities (for example, Zed can just nope out of a fight at any time and Yas has Windwall and basically infinite dashes with a huge area knockup and free shields on demand). So while all AD champs have ultra-powerful steroids running right now, the assassins are far out ahead due to their ability ratios and their plethora of escape and defensive abilities.

Assassins, as a category, should have their ability damage halved or preferably divided by three.

The alternative is to remove all damage from their auto-attacks  and decrease the AoE of their abilities to melee only in order to reign in their free farming. Assassins should not be able to farm better than any mage all while most of them don't even have mana constraints to deal with.

Assasins aren't the issue at all for tanky dps, they are actually the best calss to face with the likes of shy.(shy for example has a +50% winrate vs yasuo, but only ~30% vs mao top)
And also, there are less assasins with a solid escape then there are marksmen.
Assasins are frustraiting to face, especially as squishy, but powerwise they are balanced at best.

The issue is more that all the tanks have gotten %hp damage, gragas got %hp damage in his small rework, mao recived it, trundle recived it, shen now has, so even the low damage class does noticable damage vs tanky champs.
Aditionally, marksmen are demigods come to lategame more than ever, the amount of ranged damage comeing at you as a melee is just insane in the later stages of the game, paired with shitloads of safety from theri own kot+peeling so the only answer is beeing so slipery that you can get into combat range befor takeing any damge and/or instantly deleteing the threat.

As a tank jungler player i dont last more than 3-4 secs at best fully geared, which in the past i can survive around 10 secs. 

In the past if i died i felt like i screwed up personally, a series of mistakes that got me caught in varying degrees of being stupid, today, im 2-3 steps in the wrong position and im done for.

i used to get frustrated with bad players, these days im frustrating with the gameplay, not a good sign

now im considering other games to play with my gaming time.

My thoughts exactly

I have mentioned this many times to my friends. When I first started league (season 1 very minimal, so lets say season 2 when I got to 30) the big difference between Dota and league (at that time it was just Dota as far as I remember not Dota 2 but maybe that was out) was that in Dota every champ had an excess amount of damage and it led to quicker fights. League was like hitting with a pool noodle compared to that. Nowadays? Not sure what Dota is like now but League is what Dota used to be. Everyone (or almost everyone) can do a ton of damage and league is no longer league because of that.
Mobility creep is just as bad now
Once upon a time if you claimed to get a 1k damage critical strike you'd be called a liar. Now thats called Mid-Game.

The only way they could fix this without recreating League is to put a damage reduction on AFTER the damage is calculated. This would slow down the game IMO. I don't know much about coding but it doesn't really make a ton of sense.

It's even worse and more noticeable once someone gets a little fed and they can kill anyone on the other team in 1-2 seconds, happens every game. I think lowering damage overall would prevent some of the ridiculousness of snowballing and give people a better chance of comebacks.
so we have a consensus: Nerf penetration. Sounds good.
